abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Education Sector Support Scale Up Action Program Project is
            to expand preschool and primary education services so as to
            reach the most vulnerable groups of children through both
            demand- and supply-side interventions; and enhance
            professional and administrative institutional capacity for
            education service delivery at central, provincial, district
            and school levels. The closing date of the project will be
            extended from June 30, 2012 to December 31, 2012 in order to
            allow sufficient time to complete ongoing civil works
            (construction of schools) that were delayed because of
            recent floods. This will be the second extension and a
            cumulative extension of 30 months. Due to the heavy flooding
            that affected Cambodia in October 2011, progress on civil
            work activities was significantly delayed. The reallocation
            will finance the expansion of teacher training to focus on
            improving reading competencies of students in early grades
            and other prioritized in-service training to support
            sustainability after project closing. Provision of the
            in-service training activities is expected to reduce the
            high drop-out and repetition rate, thereby increasing the
            completion rate of the primary education cycle.
